definitions.definition: To grow weak; to lose strength; to decay; to perish gradually; to wither, as a plant.
To lose freshness, color, or brightness; to become faint in hue or tint; hence, to be wanting in color.
To sink away; to disappear gradually; to grow dim; to vanish.
definitions.example: The milkman's whistling faded into the distance.

definitions.definition: (sometimes figurative) That has lost some of its former colour or intensity.
definitions.example: a faded rock star of the 1970s
